resource_dependency.propertyDataSchema: Database table named 'properties' with columns: id (UUID), title (string), description (text), price (decimal), location (string), property_type (enum: house, apartment, condo), bedrooms (integer), bathrooms (float), square_feet (integer), image_urls (array of strings), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)

function: Display a list of property listings on the homepage
static_description: A grid layout showing multiple property cards with thumbnails, titles, prices, locations, and basic details. Background color set to alice blue (#F0F8FF) and all card elements styled with steel blue (#4682B4).

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a property card navigates to the individual property detail page without full page reload (SPA navigation).
Infinite scroll loads more property listings when reaching the bottom of the page.

resource_dependency.propertyDetailAPISchema: Endpoint /api/properties/{id} returning complete property data including id, title, description, price, location, property_type, bedrooms, bathrooms, square_feet, image_urls, amenities (array), nearby_places (array of objects with name and distance)
resource_dependency.propertyImages: Array of image URLs from property.image_urls

function: Show detailed property information on individual property pages
static_description: A detailed view displaying large property images in a carousel, followed by comprehensive information sections including price, location, specifications, description, and nearby places. Background is alice blue with steel blue text and borders.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking navigation arrows or dots in the image carousel changes the displayed property image.
Hovering over map markers for nearby places shows tooltip with place name and distance.

function: Implement a search bar for users to search properties by keywords
static_description: A prominent search bar at the top of the page with a magnifying glass icon, placeholder text 'Search properties...', and steel blue border. Background is alice blue.

interaction_and_states.description: Pressing Enter after typing initiates search and updates property listings based on keyword match in title, description, or location.
Clicking the search icon initiates search with current input value.

resource_dependency.filterOptionsSchema: Filter parameters including min_price, max_price, location, property_type, bedrooms, bathrooms

function: Provide filter options for users to refine property searches
static_description: A collapsible sidebar filter panel with multiple filter categories: Price Range (slider), Location (dropdown), Property Type (checkboxes), Bedrooms (radio buttons), Bathrooms (radio buttons). All elements styled with steel blue and alice blue background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Apply Filters' button sends selected filters to backend and updates property listings. Clicking 'Clear Filters' resets all selections.
Dragging price range slider updates min/max price values in real-time.

resource_dependency.propertyDataAPI: RESTful endpoints at /api/properties (GET), /api/properties/{id} (GET), /api/properties/search (GET), /api/properties (GET with query params)
resource_dependency.frontendHTTPClient: Axios or Fetch API configured for all property data requests

function: Fetch all property data dynamically from backend APIs
static_description: No visible UI element. Backend API configuration ensuring all property data is fetched dynamically rather than hardcoded.

interaction_and_states.description: Upon mounting, frontend components make API calls to fetch property data and update UI accordingly.
Whenever search or filter parameters change, new API requests are made to fetch updated property data.

resource_dependency.databaseConnectionConfig: PostgreSQL connection using environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp
resource_dependency.propertyTableSchema: CREATE TABLE properties (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, title VARCHAR(255), description TEXT, price DECIMAL, location VARCHAR(255), property_type VARCHAR(50), bedrooms INTEGER, bathrooms FLOAT, square_feet INTEGER, image_urls TEXT[], created_at TIMESTAMP, updated_at TIMESTAMP)

function: Connect backend to external PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables
static_description: No visible UI component. Backend database configuration file using specified environment variables to establish connection to PostgreSQL database.

interaction_and_states.description: Backend establishes connection to PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables upon application startup.
Each API request queries the connected PostgreSQL database to retrieve or update property information.

resource_dependency.apiEndpoints: RESTful endpoints: GET /api/properties, GET /api/properties/{id}, GET /api/properties/search?q=, GET /api/properties?filters=
resource_dependency.frontendAPIClient: Configured Axios/Fetch client with base URL pointing to backend server

function: Set up frontend to consume data via RESTful API endpoints
static_description: No visible UI component. Frontend configuration file setting up HTTP client to communicate with backend RESTful API endpoints.

interaction_and_states.description: Frontend components initialize HTTP clients configured to consume data from defined RESTful API endpoints.
UI interactions trigger HTTP requests to appropriate RESTful endpoints to fetch property data.

resource_dependency.spaRoutingLibrary: React Router or Vue Router for client-side routing
resource_dependency.propertyListingComponent: Reusable property listing component for both homepage and search results

function: Support browsing property listings without page reloads where applicable
static_description: Single-page application structure with router-configured navigation between property listings and detail views.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking property cards or navigation links triggers client-side routing without full page reload.
Using browser back/forward buttons navigates between previously viewed property listings and details without reloading.

resource_dependency.propertyDetailPageComponent: Dedicated component for rendering property details with dynamic route parameter

function: Allow users to click on a property listing to view its full details
static_description: Property cards with clickable areas that lead to dedicated property detail pages. Visual indication (cursor change) shows these are interactive elements.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking anywhere on a property card navigates to the corresponding property detail page using the property ID in the URL.
Right-clicking provides option to open property detail in new tab/window.

resource_dependency.filterParameters: Query parameters: min_price, max_price, location, property_type, bedrooms, bathrooms

function: Enable filtering properties by attributes such as price, location, or type
static_description: Filter controls organized by attribute categories in a sidebar panel. Controls include sliders for price range, dropdown for location, checkboxes for property type, and radio buttons for bedrooms/bathrooms.

interaction_and_states.description: Adjusting any filter control updates the displayed property listings in real-time by sending new filter parameters to the API.
Clicking 'Apply Filters' applies all selected filters simultaneously. Clicking 'Reset Filters' clears all selections.

resource_dependency.cssStylesheet: Global CSS file defining alice blue background (#F0F8FF) and steel blue elements (#4682B4)
resource_dependency.colorPalette: Primary: alice blue (#F0F8FF), Secondary: steel blue (#4682B4)

function: Ensure consistent styling with alice blue background and steel blue elements
static_description: Entire website featuring alice blue background color with all interactive elements, borders, and text headings styled in steel blue.

interaction_and_states.description: Interactive elements change shade slightly on hover while maintaining steel blue base color.
Focused form elements and buttons maintain steel blue styling with appropriate focus indicators.

function: Configure package.json to support `npm run install:all` for both frontend and backend
static_description: Root package.json file with custom scripts section containing install:all command that orchestrates installation for both frontend and backend directories.

interaction_and_states.description: Running 'npm run install:all' executes sequential installation of dependencies for both frontend and backend projects.

resource_dependency.concurrentRunner: concurrently npm package for running multiple processes

function: Configure package.json to support `npm run dev` to start both frontend and backend concurrently
static_description: Root package.json file with dev script configured to launch both frontend and backend development servers simultaneously using concurrent execution.

interaction_and_states.description: Running 'npm run dev' starts both frontend and backend development servers concurrently, displaying output from both in the same terminal.

resource_dependency.responsiveCSSFramework: CSS media queries or responsive framework (Bootstrap/Tailwind) for device-specific layouts
resource_dependency.mobileFirstDesign: Base styles optimized for mobile with progressive enhancement for larger screens

function: Implement responsive design for usability across devices
static_description: Website layout that adapts to different screen sizes with property grids becoming single column on mobile, filter sidebar becoming collapsible drawer, and text scaling appropriately.

interaction_and_states.description: Layout adjusts automatically when viewport size changes, reorganizing elements for optimal viewing on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
Touch-friendly controls with adequate spacing and sizing for mobile interaction.

resource_dependency.errorHandlingService: Centralized error handling mechanism for API failures

function: Include error handling for failed API requests or missing data
static_description: No visible UI by default. Error handling infrastructure that displays user-friendly messages when API requests fail or return no data.

interaction_and_states.description: When API requests fail, displays clear error message with retry option instead of broken UI elements.
When property data is missing required fields, displays appropriate placeholders or notifications instead of empty sections.
